contentrichtext.text: {{Use British (Oxford) English|date=December 2011}} '''IEC 60027''' (formerly '''IEC 27''') is the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]]'s [[technical standard|standard]] on ''Letter symbols to be used in electrical technology''. It consists of several parts: * IEC 60027-1: General * IEC 60027-2: Telecommunications and electronics * IEC 60027-3: Logarithmic and related quantities, and their units * IEC 60027-4: Symbols for quantities to be used for rotating electrical machines * IEC 60027-6: Control technology * IEC 60027-7: Physiological quantities and units A closely related international standard on [[physical quantity|quantities]] and [[physical unit|units]] is [[ISO 31]]. The ISO 31 and IEC 60027 Standards are being revised by the two standardization organizations in collaboration. The revised harmonized standard is known as [[ISO/IEC 80000]], Quantities and units. It supersedes both ISO 31 and part of IEC 60027. ==See also== * [[Binary prefix]] ==External links== * "[http://webstore.iec.ch/webstore/webstore.nsf/Artnum_PK/44009 IEC 60027-7 (2010-05) Ed. 1.0]" (IEC Catalog, www.iec.ch) * "[http://webstore.iec.ch/preview/info_iec60027-2%7Bed3.0%7Db.pdf IEC 60027-2 (2005-08) Ed. 3.0 Bilingual]" (preview) [[Category:IEC standards|#60027]]
